Author: meatspoon#7860
Content: @hyperDEX  As I mentioned before, I scaled into KMD with several buys over months, I chatted up my (few) crypto pals about it, I mined KMD for several months and then I attempted to participate in the BarterDex Beer swap which was a shitshow.  I have alpha and beta tested software, and the BarterDex Beer swap brought back memories.  Not good ones.  Concurrently the price was plummeting which made mining incredibly unprofitable relative to other options.  All the while I saw a complete lack of marketing with only promises to fix it (for months), I saw KMD announcements about hiring people who only had first names (read: no verifiable identity) and didn't have public resumes, the Agama wallet continued to be a cumbersome tribute to what I might call an art style of GUI Brutalism.  So I researched a lot, bought some, mined some, talked it up to friends when I was intrigued by it.  Perhaps that is not enough in your opinion.  Shrug.  Maybe you think that investing/speculating/mining to secure the network might not be enough, and if so, I didn't do enough, comrade.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: @meatspoon If the marketing is so bad how about offering suggestions on how to make it better, why not find other people that are doing great marketing and suggesting that to the team?

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: I have been here for close to 4 years, i have seen the ups and downs. I saw there was a gap in the GUI for regular users and  put my time and money into fixing that hole. This included bringing on devs from outside to make sure we make it as good as we can, whilst having fresh eyes on the code base.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: And i am not the smartest tool in the shed as they say.

Content: It all comes down to - how can i help this project increase in usage which will bring on more value?

Author: meatspoon#7860
Content:
I have made my opinions clear here.  They seem to be opinions that have been voiced before.  No one seems to argue against the assertion that KMD has a huge marketing deficiency.  I noted earlier, if you Google KMD or YouTube it, the results are mostly poor quality ramblings by people who cant adequately explain the tech.   And even when I voice concerns here, I just have long-timers telling me I just don't understand the tech like they do, but they are unable or unwilling to actually explain it.  So Google searches don't do KMD justice, YouTube searches result in a bunch of speculative people that can't explain the inherent value it it, and here on Discord critical voices are shouted down as being trolls or whatever.

I am not looking for a hobby.   I don't want to contribute my time or capital to BTC, ETH, LTC, XLM, KMD or any of the other projects/coins I own.  I am not a boy scout, I am an investor.  KMD has disappointed me with their lack of marketing, transparency, ability launch projects, the half baked nature of the Beer swap.  Its just my opinion.  I still root for KMD because I own it, but I am a disappointed investor who wants to be heard and instead of saying, "I hear your concerns and they are valid," most of the KMD people in this thread want to call me a troll or whatever.  This is an echo chamber in here.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: KMD is a ambitious project. It will take many many iterations to make what we have use friendly enough for grandma. Until that point it is hard to market. Marketing for vaporware is easy, it works 100%. Marketing for a POC is not easy, it can fail.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: MM 1.0 that powers barterDEX and hyperDEX is not ready for a huge marketing campaign. It works if you use command line and know what you are doing, If you are using the GUI it works sometimes and not others. This is the whole reason why MM 2.0 is being made. It is taking this POC and making sure all the usability/network issues are address for mass consumption.
